channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-13131] TezWork queryName can be null after HIVE-12523
item.description: Looks like after HIVE-12523, the queryName field can be null, either if the conf passed in is null, or if the conf does not contain the necessary settings.
item.summary: TezWork queryName can be null after HIVE-12523

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Why is a null query name allowed? Shouldn't that be an error, instead of setting it to the dagId.

It looks like the previous behavior was to always set it to the dagId. I'm not too familiar with the usage here - if you think it should be an error then we can do that too. However if the conf passed in is null I think we should still default to dagId.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12789356/HIVE-13131.1.patch
